definition: popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate

sentences.english: Besides, the McCain dictum is debatable.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，麦凯恩的顺口溜也值得商榷。

sentences.english: This is the jingle that people writes to me.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们给我编的顺口溜。
这是一个小男孩的顺口溜。

sentences.english: " Reporting the dish names" is an excellent Guankou piece of traditional cross talk.
sentences.chinese: 《报菜名》是传统相声中一段很精彩的顺口溜。

sentences.english: Jingle Ma is still young at heart.
sentences.chinese: 顺口溜马是还年轻的心。

definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
pet phrase/regularly used expression/manner of speaking
to flow right off the tongue (of lyrics or poetry)/to recite with ease/catchy (of a song)
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
